009package imagingbook.common.geometry.basic;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
014
015/**
016 * Implementing classes know how to create an AWT {@link Shape}.
017 * TODO: Rename to ShapeProducer or merge with {@link Curve2d}?
018 * @author WB
019 *
020 */
021public interface ShapeProvider {
022        
023        /**
024         * Returns a scaled {@link Shape} for this object
025         * (default scale is 1).
026         * Must be defined by implementing classes.
027         * The interpretation of the scale factor is left to the implementing class.
028         * For example, for {@link Pnt2d} it specifies the size of the marker 
029         * (see {@link Pnt2d#getShape(double)}.
030         * 
031         * @param scale the scale of the shape
032         * @return a {@link Shape} instance
033         */
034        public Shape getShape(double scale);
035        
036        /**
037         * Returns a {@link Shape} for this object at the
038         * default scale (1).
039         * @return a {@link Shape} instance
040         */
041        public default Shape getShape() {
042                return getShape(1);
043        };
044        
045        /**
046         * Returns a fixed sequence of {@link Shape} items for drawing this object,
047         * which must contain at least one item.
048         * This is to produce graphic representations that are too complex for
049         * a single {@link Shape} item.
050         * The returned shapes may also be displayed with different strokes or colors.
051         * <p>
052         * By default, this method returns a single item which is the primary
053         * shape (obtained by {@link #getShape(double)}).
054         * Implementing classes should override this method if more than one
055         * shape must be returned 
056         * For example, a {@link GeometricEllipse} returns three shape items:
057         * (a) the ellipse curve, (b) the center mark, (c) the major axes
058         * (see {@link GeometricEllipse#getShapes(double)}).
059         * </p>
060         * 
061         * @param scale a scale factor (may be used or ignored)
062         * @return sequence of {@link Shape} items
063         */
064        public default Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
065                return new Shape[] { getShape(scale) };
066        }
067        
068        public default Shape[] getShapes() {
069                return getShapes(1);
070        }
071        
072}
